io.straas.android.sdk.media

Class StraasMediaCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.straas.android.sdk.media.StraasMediaCore

  • public final class StraasMediaCore
extends Object
    The core which will create a MediaBrowserCompat for you to connect to the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat, also handles the video and ad rendering layers.

    Don't forget to fill the SDK credential and the member Identity.

      Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to indicate the broadcast status of the live event(v2).

      Bundle value for indicate that the live event meets a trouble now, our server is waiting for the streaming.

      Bundle value for indicate that the live event is ready to broadcast.
      static String LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_STARTED
      Bundle value for indicate that the live event is on LIVE now, while the the broadcast status may be LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_LIVE or LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_WAIT_STREAM.

      video frame is scaled to fill the size of the view by maintaining the aspect ratio.
      static int PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_FIT
      video frame is scaled to fit the size of the view by maintaining the aspect ratio (black borders may be displayed).
      static int PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_FULL
      The specified aspect ratio is ignored.

      • KEY_CURRENT_VIDEO_FORMAT_INDEX

        public static final String KEY_CURRENT_VIDEO_FORMAT_INDEX
        Use this Bundle key to get and set current format index.

      • COMMAND_SET_FORMAT_INDEX

        Action command for set new video format index.
        See Also:
        KEY_CURRENT_VIDEO_FORMAT_INDEX, MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.sendCustomAction(String, Bundle), Constant Field Values

      • COMMAND_GET_VIDEO_FORMATS

        public static final String COMMAND_GET_VIDEO_FORMATS
        Command for getting all video tracks formats. Below is an example for query all formats as list and which index is selected currently. 
        
 public static void getVideoQualityInfo(MediaControllerCompat controller) {
     controller.sendCommand(COMMAND_GET_VIDEO_FORMATS, null,
         new ResultReceiver(new Handler()) {
             @Override
             protected void onReceiveResult(int resultCode, Bundle resultData) {
                 resultData.setClassLoader(Format.class.getClassLoader());
                 if (resultData.containsKey(KEY_CURRENT_VIDEO_FORMAT_INDEX)) {
                     // all video tracks formats
                     ArrayList<Format> formats = resultData
                        .getParcelableArrayList(KEY_ALL_VIDEO_FORMATS);
                     // current format index of formats
                     int selectedIndex = resultData.getInt(KEY_CURRENT_VIDEO_FORMAT_INDEX);
                 }
             }
         });
 }
        See Also:
        KEY_ALL_VIDEO_FORMATS, KEY_CURRENT_VIDEO_FORMAT_INDEX, Constant Field Values

      • COMMAND_FOREGROUND

        public static final String COMMAND_FOREGROUND
        Enable foreground flag, this will make the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat run in foreground when player state is not PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_PAUSED, PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_STOPPED, or PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_NONE. You can use KEY_NOTIFICATION_OPTIONS and NotificationOptions to set some options of the Notification.
        See Also:
        Service.startForeground(int, Notification), MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.sendCustomAction(String, Bundle), KEY_NOTIFICATION_OPTIONS, EXTRA_SERVICE_FOREGROUND_IS_ENABLED, Constant Field Values

      • COMMAND_STOP_FOREGROUND

        public static final String COMMAND_STOP_FOREGROUND
        Remove the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat from foreground state and clear the Notification.
        See Also:
        Service.stopForeground(boolean), MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.sendCustomAction(String, Bundle), EXTRA_SERVICE_FOREGROUND_IS_ENABLED, Constant Field Values

      • COMMAND_DISABLE_AUDIO

        public static final String COMMAND_DISABLE_AUDIO
        Command to disable/re-enable audio output immediately and all future media playback.

        There are some important things you should notice when using this command:

        • When developer disable the audio output during playback, previously obtained audio focus will be abandoned internally.
        • Re-enable the audio output during playback will be accompanied by a successful audio focus request internally.
        • If developer makes the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat run in foreground by using COMMAND_FOREGROUND while the audio output is disabled, we will force re-enable the audio output.
        • Disable the audio output during the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat runs in foreground will be no-op. A warning message will show up in the logcat instead.
        
 public static void disableAudio(MediaControllerCompat controller, boolean disable) {
        Bundle bundle = new Bundle();
        bundle.putBoolean(KEY_DISABLE_AUDIO, disable);
        controller.getTransportControls().sendCustomAction(COMMAND_DISABLE_AUDIO, bundle);
 }
        See Also:
        EXTRA_IS_AUDIO_DISABLED, KEY_DISABLE_AUDIO, Constant Field Values

      • COMMAND_PLAY_AT_LIVE_EDGE

        public static final String COMMAND_PLAY_AT_LIVE_EDGE
        Command to seek the current playback position to the real-time coverage of live (live edge) and play automatically.

        This command won't work under the following conditions:

        • If the current playing media is not a live
        • If VideoCustomMetadata.LIVE_DVR_ENABLED is false
        • If VideoCustomMetadata.CUSTOM_METADATA_IS_LIVE_LOW_LATENCY_FIRST is true
        See Also:
        MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.sendCustomAction(String, Bundle), Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_IS_AUDIO_DISABLED

        public static final String EXTRA_IS_AUDIO_DISABLED
        Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to indicate whether the audio output is disabled. Bundle value is boolean type, the default value is false.

        For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via MediaControllerCompat.registerCallback(Callback) to get extras.

        See Also:
        COMMAND_DISABLE_AUDIO, KEY_DISABLE_AUDIO, Constant Field Values

      • KEY_DISABLE_AUDIO

        public static final String KEY_DISABLE_AUDIO
        Use this Bundle key to set whether the audio output should be disabled or not to the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat. Bundle value is boolean type, true means the audio output will be disabled.
        See Also:
        COMMAND_DISABLE_AUDIO, MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.sendCustomAction(String, Bundle), EXTRA_IS_AUDIO_DISABLED, Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_SERVICE_FOREGROUND_IS_ENABLED

        public static final String EXTRA_SERVICE_FOREGROUND_IS_ENABLED
        Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to get the boolean value that indicates the foreground mode is enabled or not. If foreground mode is enabled, the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat will run in foreground when player state is not PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_PAUSED, PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_STOPPED, or PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_NONE.

        For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via MediaControllerCompat.registerCallback(Callback) to get extras.

        See Also:
        COMMAND_FOREGROUND, COMMAND_STOP_FOREGROUND, Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_CONTENT_TYPE

        public static final String EXTRA_CONTENT_TYPE
        Extra Bundle key only if you want to use playFromUri to play content outside of StraaS server storage without explicit filename extension (e.g. *.mp4, *.m3u8).

        The content type value mapping is the same as ExoPlayer: 

        
  public static void playContentType(MediaControllerCompat controller, Uri uri, int type) {
      Bundle bundle = new Bundle();
      switch (type) {
          case C.TYPE_HLS:
          case C.TYPE_DASH:
          case C.TYPE_SS:
          case C.TYPE_OTHER:
              bundle.putInt(EXTRA_CONTENT_TYPE, type);
              break;
          default:
              throw new IllegalArgumentException("Must be one of TYPE_HLS, TYPE_DASH, TYPE_SS, TYPE_OTHER");
      }
      controller.getTransportControls().playFromUri(uri, bundle);
  }
        See Also:
        MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.playFromUri(Uri, Bundle), C.TYPE_DASH, C.TYPE_HLS, C.TYPE_SS, C.TYPE_OTHER, Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_TEXT_TRACKS_INFO

      • KEY_PAGE_TOKEN

        public static final String KEY_PAGE_TOKEN
        Bundle key we put in the last MediaBrowserCompat.MediaItem of a list to indicate what next parent id is. Use the value to subscribe and you will get the next page content. 
        
 public static String extractPageToken(@NonNull List<MediaItem> items) {
     return items.get(items.size() - 1)
             .getDescription().getExtras().getString(KEY_PAGE_TOKEN);
 }

 public void onLoadMore() {
     String pageToken = extractPageToken(mAdapter.getMediaItems());
     if (!TextUtils.isEmpty(pageToken)) {
         getMediaBrowser().subscribe(pageToken, mSubscriptionCallback);
     }
 }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAY_OPTION_SEEK_TIME

        public static final String PLAY_OPTION_SEEK_TIME
        Extra Bundle key only if you need to seek to the specific timestamp at start.

        During the playback you could use MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.seekTo(long). 

        
  public static void playAndSeekFromMediaId(MediaControllerCompat controller, String mediaId, long positionMs) {
      Bundle bundle = new Bundle();
      bundle.putLong(PLAY_OPTION_SEEK_TIME, positionMs);
      controller.getTransportControls().playFromMediaId(mediaId, bundle);
  }
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAY_OPTION_LIVE_LOW_LATENCY_FIRST

        public static final String PLAY_OPTION_LIVE_LOW_LATENCY_FIRST
        Extra Bundle key in playFromMediaId which could significantly reduce the latency between broadcaster and viewers if set the Bundle value to true, but the adaptive bitrate will be disabled.

        NOTE: This flag is only in BETA stage, it might be deprecated in later version.

      • KEY_VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE

        public static final String KEY_VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE
        Extra Bundle key only if you want to use playFromUri to play content outside of StraaS server storage and want to control different render type. 
        
  public static void playWithRenderType(MediaControllerCompat controller, Uri uri, int type) {
      Bundle bundle = new Bundle();
      switch (type) {
          case VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE_360:
          case VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE_PLAIN:
              bundle.putInt(KEY_VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE, type);
              break;
          default:
              bundle.putInt(KEY_VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE, VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE_PLAIN);
              break;
      }
      controller.getTransportControls().playFromUri(uri, bundle);
  }
        See Also:
        MediaControllerCompat.TransportControls.playFromUri(Uri, Bundle), VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE_360, VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE_PLAIN, Constant Field Values

      • PARENT_ID_LIVES

        public static final String PARENT_ID_LIVES
        Parent id to subscribe all available public live event list. You could get broadcastStateV2 by using the extra bundle in MediaBrowserCompat.MediaItem.getDescription() with LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_V2 key. If you subscribe live event list without given sort option, the default sorting type will be "-start_time".
        See Also:
        MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_SORT, Constant Field Values

      • PARENT_ID_VODS

        public static final String PARENT_ID_VODS
        Parent id to subscribe all available public VOD (video on demand) list. If you subscribe VOD list without given sort option, the default sorting type will be "-created_at".
        See Also:
        MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, Bundle, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_SORT, Constant Field Values

      • SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_SORT

        public static final String SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_SORT
        Bundle key when subscribing to a parent id with an optional Bundle. You must use putString to set the sorting type depends on what kinds of parent id you want to subscribe. This value denote how to sort the children list data.

        e.g. "-created_at"
        See Also:
        VOD list, Live list, Constant Field Values

      • SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_OWNER_MEMBER_ID

        public static final String SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_OWNER_MEMBER_ID
        Bundle key when subscribing to a parent id with an optional Bundle. You must use putString to set the owner member id filter to query partial children list data belonging to the specific owner only.

        Empty value denotes disabling this filter.
        See Also:
        VOD list, Live list, Constant Field Values

      • SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_CATEGORY_IDS

        public static final String SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_CATEGORY_IDS
        Bundle key when subscribing to a parent id with an optional Bundle. You must use putString to set the category ids filter to query partial children list data belonging to the specific categories.

        Empty value denotes disabling this filter.

        e.g. "1,3,5"
        See Also:
        VOD list, Live list, Constant Field Values

      • SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_TYPES

        public static final String SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_TYPES
        Bundle key when subscribing to a parent id with an optional Bundle. You must use putString to set the types filter to query partial live list data belonging to the specific types.

        Empty value denotes disabling this filter.

        This option is only for live events.

        e.g. "event,channel" for live event
        See Also:
        Live list, Constant Field Values

      • SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_STATUS

        public static final String SUBSCRIBE_CHILDREN_OPTIONS_STATUS
        Bundle key when subscribing to a parent id with an optional Bundle. You must use putString to set the status filter to query partial live list data belonging to the specific status.

        Empty value denotes disabling this filter.

        This option is only for live events.

        e.g. "ready,ended"
        See Also:
        Live list, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_START_TIME

        See Also:
        LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE

        @Deprecated
public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE
        Deprecated. use LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_V2 instead
        Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to indicate the broadcast status of the live event. For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via MediaControllerCompat.registerCallback(Callback) to get extras.

        If extra Bundle don't have this key, of the value is empty, means that the live event is offline, otherwise, the value will be either LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_LIVE or LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_WAIT_STREAM.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_V2

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_V2
        Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to indicate the broadcast status of the live event(v2). For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via MediaControllerCompat.registerCallback(Callback) to get extras.

        The value must be one of the following:

        • LiveEventListener.BROADCAST_STATE_UNKNOWN
        • LiveEventListener.BROADCAST_STATE_STARTED
        • LiveEventListener.BROADCAST_STATE_STOPPED
        • LiveEventListener.BROADCAST_STATE_WAITING_FOR_STREAM
        • LiveEventListener.BROADCAST_STATE_ENDED
        • LiveEventListener.BROADCAST_STATE_DVR_PLAYBACK_AVAILABLE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_LIVE

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_LIVE
        Bundle value for indicate that the broadcast status of the live event is on LIVE now.
        See Also:
        LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE, LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_WAIT_STREAM, LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_START_TIME, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_WAIT_STREAM

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_WAIT_STREAM
        Bundle value for indicate that the live event meets a trouble now, our server is waiting for the streaming. The future state may be LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_LIVE or offline.
        See Also:
        LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE, LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_LIVE, LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_START_TIME, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE

        @Deprecated
public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE
        Deprecated. use LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_V2 instead
        Bundle key for indicate that an live event status. For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via MediaControllerCompat.registerCallback(Callback) to get extras.

        The state value must be one of the following:

        • LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_READY
        • LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_STARTED
        • LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_ENDED
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_ENDED

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_ENDED
        Bundle value for indicate that the live event is ended.
        See Also:
        LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE, LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_READY, LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_STARTED, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_READY

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_READY
        Bundle value for indicate that the live event is ready to broadcast.
        See Also:
        LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE, LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_ENDED, LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_STARTED, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_STARTED

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_STARTED
        Bundle value for indicate that the live event is on LIVE now, while the the broadcast status may be LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_LIVE or LIVE_EXTRA_BROADCAST_STATE_WAIT_STREAM.
        See Also:
        LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE, LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_READY, LIVE_EXTRA_EVENT_STATE_ENDED, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_STATISTICS_CCU

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_STATISTICS_CCU
        Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to indicate the concurrent users of the live event. For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via registerCallback(...) and listen either onSessionEvent or onExtrasChanged to get real-time value change. Both the event name and the Bundle key is this constant, value is an integer.
        See Also:
        doc, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_STATISTICS_HIT_COUNT

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_STATISTICS_HIT_COUNT
        Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to indicate the media hit count of the live event. For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via registerCallback(...) and listen either onSessionEvent or onExtrasChanged to get real-time value change. Both the event name and the Bundle key is this constant, value is an integer.
        See Also:
        doc, Constant Field Values

      • KEY_EXTRA_TEXT_TRACKS

        public static final String KEY_EXTRA_TEXT_TRACKS
        Bundle key in MediaSessionCompat extra to indicate the subtitle list. For client side, use MediaControllerCompat.getExtras() or register callback via registerCallback(...) and listen onExtrasChanged to get real-time value change. Both the event name and the Bundle key is this constant, value is string which can convert to subtitle list.
        See Also:
        Cue, Constant Field Values

      • LIVE_EXTRA_CURRENT_DATE_TIME

        public static final String LIVE_EXTRA_CURRENT_DATE_TIME
        Bundle key in PlaybackStateCompat extra to indicate the current live date time from HLS EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag. For client side, use PlaybackStateCompat.getExtras() to inference live date time according to current position.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DRM_SCHEME_UUID_EXTRA

        public static final String DRM_SCHEME_UUID_EXTRA
        See Also:
        HttpMediaDrmCallback, Constant Field Values

      • DISPLAY_MODE_NORMAL

        public static final int DISPLAY_MODE_NORMAL
        video frame window is displayed normally.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISPLAY_MODE_CARDBOARD

        public static final int DISPLAY_MODE_CARDBOARD
        video frame is divided into two windows for left and right eye respectively, useful when user put device into cardboard.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_FIT

        public static final int PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_FIT
        video frame is scaled to fit the size of the view by maintaining the aspect ratio (black borders may be displayed).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_CROP

        public static final int PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_CROP
        video frame is scaled to fill the size of the view by maintaining the aspect ratio. Some portion of the video frame may be clipped.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_FULL

        public static final int PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_FULL
        The specified aspect ratio is ignored.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • StraasMediaCore

        public StraasMediaCore(@NonNull
                       Identity identity,
                       @NonNull
                       MediaBrowserCompat.ConnectionCallback callback)
        Create a MediaBrowserCompat which could get through getMediaBrowser().
        Parameters:
        identity - The user who connecting to the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat. If you want to change the identity later, use setIdentity(Identity) after MediaBrowserCompat is connected.
        callback - The callback which will tell you whether the MediaBrowserCompat is connected or not. If you get MediaBrowserCompat.ConnectionCallback.onConnectionFailed(), normally causing by getting the CredentialFailException, checkout logcat first.

      • StraasMediaCore

        public StraasMediaCore(@NonNull
                       StraasMediaCore.UiContainer uiContainer,
                       @NonNull
                       Identity identity,
                       @NonNull
                       MediaBrowserCompat.ConnectionCallback callback)
        Create a MediaBrowserCompat which could get through getMediaBrowser().

        Use this constructor, you don't have to call setUiContainer(UiContainer) again unless you want to reset the container target.

        Parameters:
        uiContainer - The container which renders the video track. Normally just put the StraasPlayerView. You could reset the container target later using setUiContainer(UiContainer).
        identity - The user who connecting to the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat. If you want to change the identity later, use setIdentity(Identity) after MediaBrowserCompat is connected.
        callback - The callback which will tell you whether the MediaBrowserCompat is connected or not. If you get MediaBrowserCompat.ConnectionCallback.onConnectionFailed(), normally causing by getting the CredentialFailException, checkout logcat first.

    • Method Detail

      • setDisplayMode

        public void setDisplayMode(int displayMode)
        Set how video frame window is displayed.
        Parameters:
        displayMode - when put device into cardboard, set to {DISPLAY_MODE_CARDBOARD}

      • setPlaneProjectionMode

        public void setPlaneProjectionMode(int planeProjectionMode)
        Set projection mode when render type is VIDEO_RENDER_TYPE_PLAIN which is a plain instead of sphere.
        Parameters:
        planeProjectionMode - default is PLANE_PROJECTION_MODE_FIT

      • setIdentity

        public void setIdentity(Identity identity)
        Set a new identity after MediaBrowser is connected. MUST call after getMediaBrowser() is connected, or you will receive IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        identity - The new identity.
        See Also:
        Identity, #StraasMediaCore(UiContainer, Identity, ConnectionCallback), #StraasMediaCore(Identity, ConnectionCallback)

      • getMediaController

        @Nullable
public MediaControllerCompat getMediaController()
        Returns:
        After received MediaBrowserCompat.ConnectionCallback.onConnected(), you could get a non-null MediaControllerCompat, or build your own MediaControllerCompat through MediaBrowserCompat.getSessionToken().

      • setUiContainer

        public StraasMediaCore setUiContainer(@Nullable
                                      StraasMediaCore.UiContainer uiContainer)
        Optional API only if you didn't put it at constructor, or you want to change the container target.
        Parameters:
        uiContainer - The player view which video and ad will render within it. Use StraasPlayerView is the best choice or you want to implement your self.
        See Also:
        #StraasMediaCore(UiContainer, Identity, ConnectionCallback)

                                    StraasMediaCore.ImaHelperBase imaHelper)
        Optional API only if you need Interactive Media Ad integration.

        Include extension-ima library and give us the ImaHelper.newInstance().

        Parameters:
        imaHelper - ImaHelper.newInstance()

      • getMediaBrowser

        @NonNull
public MediaBrowserCompat getMediaBrowser()
        This instance reference MAY change any time, DO-NOT keep this reference. Always use getMediaBrowser().
        Returns:
        The generated MediaBrowserCompat. Use it to connect to the StraaS MediaBrowserServiceCompat.
